001package io.github.ai4ci.config;
002
003import java.io.IOException;
004import java.nio.file.Files;
005import java.nio.file.Path;
006import java.util.ArrayList;
007import java.util.Arrays;
008import java.util.Collections;
009import java.util.List;
010import java.util.stream.Collectors;
011
012import org.immutables.value.Value;
013
014import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonIgnore;
015import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonInclude.Include;
016import com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonParser;
017import com.fasterxml.jackson.core.exc.StreamWriteException;
018import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.DatabindException;
019import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper;
020import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.SerializationFeature;
021import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.annotation.JsonDeserialize;
022import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.annotation.JsonSerialize;
023import com.fasterxml.jackson.datatype.guava.GuavaModule;
024
025import io.github.ai4ci.config.execution.ExecutionConfiguration;
026import io.github.ai4ci.config.execution.ImmutableExecutionConfiguration;
027import io.github.ai4ci.config.setup.ImmutableSetupConfiguration;
028import io.github.ai4ci.config.setup.SetupConfiguration;
029import io.github.ai4ci.flow.output.SimulationExporter;
030import io.github.ai4ci.util.ReflectionUtils;
031
032/**
033 * Central configuration interface for JPanSim2 experiments.
034 *
035 * <p>
036 * This immutable configuration interface defines all parameters needed to run
037 * an experiment in JPanSim2, including:
038 * <ul>
039 * <li>Batch job configurations (via {@link BatchConfiguration})</li>
040 * <li>Setup configurations (via {@link SetupConfiguration} and
041 * {@link SetupFacet})</li>
042 * <li>Execution configurations (via {@link ExecutionConfiguration} and
043 * {@link ExecutionFacet})</li>
044 * <li>Replication counts for both setup and execution phases</li>
045 * </ul>
046 *
047 * <p>
048 * Key features:
049 * <ul>
050 * <li>Supports SLURM parallelisation through batch configuration</li>
051 * <li>Provides methods for generating configuration subsets per batch node</li>
052 * <li>Includes JSON serialisation/deserialisation capabilities</li>
053 * <li>Allows configuration composition through facets and modifications</li>
054 * </ul>
055 *
056 * <p>
057 * Each experiment consists of a set of simulation setups (defined by setup
058 * facets) and a set of execution configurations (defined by execution facets).
059 * The configuration supports generating all combinations of setups and
060 * executions, as well as replicating each configuration multiple times for
061 * statistical robustness. In the end the number of simulations run will be:
062 * <ul>
063 * <li>Number of setups = product of modifications across all setup facets</li>
064 * <li>Number of executions = product of modifications across all execution
065 * facets</li>
066 * <li>Total simulations = setups * executions * setup replications * execution
067 * replications</li>
068 * </ul>
069 * Different setup facets or setup replications will usually be shared between
070 * different SLURM nodes, but the execution configurations and execution
071 * replications will be typically be run in parallel within one node according
072 * to the batch configuration. The optimal SLURM parallelisation will therefore
073 * be to have a node per setup facet * setup replication and then run all
074 * execution facets and execution replications in parallel within each node.
075 *
076 * <p>
077 * Example usage:
078 *
079 * <pre>{@code
080 * ExperimentConfiguration config = ExperimentConfiguration.readConfig(path);
081 * BatchConfiguration batchConfig = config.getBatchConfig();
082 * List<SetupConfiguration> setups = config.getBatchSetupList();
083 * }</pre>
084 *
085 * @author Rob Challen
086 * @see BatchConfiguration
087 * @see SetupConfiguration
088 * @see ExecutionConfiguration
089 */
090@Value.Immutable
091@Value.Modifiable
092@JsonSerialize(as = ImmutableExperimentConfiguration.class)
093@JsonDeserialize(as = ImmutableExperimentConfiguration.class)
094public interface ExperimentConfiguration {
095
096        /**
097         * Default immutable configuration instance used when no other configuration
098         * is provided. Includes:
099         * <ul>
100         * <li>Defaults from {@link BatchConfiguration#DEFAULT}</li>
101         * <li>Single setup facet with {@link SetupConfiguration#DEFAULT}</li>
102         * <li>{@link ExecutionConfiguration#DEFAULT}</li>
103         * <li>1 replication for both setup and execution</li>
104         * </ul>
105         */
106        ImmutableExperimentConfiguration DEFAULT = ImmutableExperimentConfiguration
107                .builder()
108                .setBatchConfig(BatchConfiguration.DEFAULT)
109                .setSetupConfig(List.of(SetupFacet.of(SetupConfiguration.DEFAULT)))
110                .setExecutionConfig(ExecutionConfiguration.DEFAULT)
111                .setExecutionReplications(1)
112                .setSetupReplications(1)
113                .build();
114
115        /**
116         * Reads and deserializes an ExperimentConfiguration from a JSON file.
117         * Supports JSON with comments and handles Guava collection types.
118         *
119         * @param file Path to JSON configuration file
120         * @return Deserialized ExperimentConfiguration
121         * @throws StreamWriteException on JSON parsing errors
122         * @throws DatabindException    on data binding issues
123         * @throws IOException          on file system errors
124         * @see #writeConfig(Path, boolean)
125         */
126        static ExperimentConfiguration readConfig(Path file)
127                        throws StreamWriteException, DatabindException, IOException {
128                var om = new ObjectMapper();
129                om.enable(SerializationFeature.INDENT_OUTPUT);
130                om.enable(JsonParser.Feature.ALLOW_COMMENTS);
131                om.registerModules(new GuavaModule());
132                om.setSerializationInclusion(Include.NON_NULL);
133                var rt = (ExperimentConfiguration) om
134                        .readerFor(ExperimentConfiguration.class)
135                        .readValue(file.toFile());
136                return rt;
137        }
138
139        /**
140         * Creates a SimulationExporter configured for this experiment's batch
141         * settings. The exporter will use the batch-specific output directory if
142         * running in a multi-node SLURM batch job.
143         *
144         * @param baseDirectory Root directory for output files
145         * @return Configured SimulationExporter instance
146         * @see #getBatchDirectoryPath(Path)
147         */
148        @JsonIgnore
149        default SimulationExporter exporter(Path baseDirectory) {
150                return SimulationExporter.of(
151                        this.getBatchDirectoryPath(baseDirectory),
152                        Arrays.stream(
153                                this.getBatchConfig()
154                                        .getExporters()
155                        )
156                                .map(e -> e.getSelector())
157                                .collect(Collectors.toList())
158                );
159        }
160
161        /**
162         * Gets the batch configuration parameters for SLURM job parallelisation.
163         *
164         * @return Immutable batch configuration instance
165         * @see BatchConfiguration
166         */
167        ImmutableBatchConfiguration getBatchConfig();
168
169        /**
170         * Gets the batch-specific output directory path. In multi-node SLURM jobs,
171         * this returns a subdirectory named with the batch number. Otherwise returns
172         * the base directory unchanged.
173         *
174         * @param baseDirectory Root directory for output files
175         * @return Batch-specific output directory path
176         */
177        @JsonIgnore
178        default Path getBatchDirectoryPath(Path baseDirectory) {
179                if (this.getBatchConfig()
180                        .getBatchTotal() <= 1) { return baseDirectory; }
181                return baseDirectory.resolve(
182                        "" + this.getBatchConfig()
183                                .getBatchNumber()
184                );
185        }
186
187        /**
188         * Generates a subset of experiment setups relevant to the current SLURM
189         * node. When running in a multi-node SLURM batch job, this method splits the
190         * full setup list into chunks and returns only the portion assigned to this
191         * node.
192         *
193         * @return List of setup configurations for this batch node
194         * @see #getSetup()
195         */
196        @JsonIgnore
197        default List<SetupConfiguration> getBatchSetupList() {
198
199                if (this.getBatchConfig()
200                        .getBatchTotal() <= 1) {
201                        return this.getSetup();
202                }
203
204                var size = this.getSetup()
205                        .size();
206                if (size == 1) { return this.getSetup(); }
207
208                // Handle SLURM parallelisation. Split list into N chunks based on number
209                // of batches
210                var chunkSize = (int) Math.ceil(
211                        ((double) size) / this.getBatchConfig()
212                                .getBatchTotal()
213                );
214
215                // This is going to be made up of a list of setups and replicates.
216                // each replicate is stand alone so we can just filter this list to
217                // get to the list for this node.
218                var start = (this.getBatchConfig()
219                        .getBatchNumber() - 1) * chunkSize;
220                var end = Math.min(
221                        this.getBatchConfig()
222                                .getBatchNumber() * chunkSize,
223                        size
224                );
225                if (start >= size) { return Collections.emptyList(); }
226                return this.getSetup()
227                        .subList(start, end);
228
229        }
230
231        /**
232         * Generates all execution configurations by applying all modifications from
233         * execution facets and expanding replications. This includes:
234         * <ul>
235         * <li>Applying all modifications from execution facets</li>
236         * <li>Generating replicated configurations when replications > 1</li>
237         * <li>Ensuring each configuration has a unique name</li>
238         * </ul>
239         *
240         * @return Complete list of execution configurations with modifications
241         *         applied
242         * @throws RuntimeException if any modification lacks a name
243         */
244        @JsonIgnore
245        default List<ExecutionConfiguration> getExecution() {
246
247                var base = this.getExecutionConfig();
248                List<ImmutableExecutionConfiguration> out = new ArrayList<>();
249                out.add(base);
250                for (ExecutionFacet facet : this.getFacets()) {
251
252                        var facetName = facet.getName();
253                        List<ImmutableExecutionConfiguration> tmp = new ArrayList<>();
254
255                        for (Modification<ExecutionConfiguration> mod : facet
256                                .getModifications()) {
257
258                                if (mod instanceof PartialExecutionConfiguration) {
259
260                                        if (mod.self()
261                                                .getName() == null) {
262                                                throw new RuntimeException(
263                                                                "Modifications must have a value for name"
264                                                );
265                                        }
266
267                                        out.forEach(b -> {
268                                                var modified = (ImmutableExecutionConfiguration) ReflectionUtils
269                                                        .merge(b, mod)
270                                                        .withName(
271                                                                (!b.getName()
272                                                                        .equals(base.getName()) ? b.getName() + ":" : "")
273                                                                                + facetName + ":" + mod.self()
274                                                                                        .getName()
275                                                        );
276                                                tmp.add(modified);
277                                        });
278                                }
279                        }
280                        out = tmp;
281
282                }
283
284                List<ExecutionConfiguration> tmp = new ArrayList<>();
285                for (var i = 0; i < this.getExecutionReplications(); i++) {
286                        for (ExecutionConfiguration b : out) {
287                                tmp.add(b.withReplicate(i));
288                        }
289                }
290
291                return tmp;
292
293        }
294
295        /**
296         * Gets the base execution configuration before modifications.
297         *
298         * @return Immutable base execution configuration
299         * @see ExecutionConfiguration
300         */
301        ImmutableExecutionConfiguration getExecutionConfig();
302
303        /**
304         * Gets the number of replications to generate for each execution
305         * configuration.
306         *
307         * @return Number of execution replications (minimum 1)
308         */
309        int getExecutionReplications();
310
311        /**
312         * Gets the list of execution facets containing modifications to apply.
313         * Facets are processed in order with each modification building on previous
314         * results.
315         *
316         * @return List of execution configuration facets
317         * @see ExecutionFacet
318         */
319        List<ExecutionFacet> getFacets();
320
321        /**
322         * Generates all setup configurations by applying all modifications from
323         * setup facets and expanding replications. This includes:
324         * <ul>
325         * <li>Applying all modifications from setup facets</li>
326         * <li>Generating replicated configurations when replications > 1</li>
327         * <li>Ensuring each configuration has a unique name</li>
328         * </ul>
329         *
330         * @return Complete list of setup configurations with modifications applied
331         * @throws RuntimeException if any modification lacks a name
332         */
333        @JsonIgnore
334        default List<SetupConfiguration> getSetup() {
335
336                List<SetupConfiguration> tmp = new ArrayList<>();
337                var setupCfg = this.getSetupConfig();
338
339                for (SetupFacet facet : setupCfg) {
340
341                        var base = facet.getDefault();
342
343                        if (facet.getModifications()
344                                .isEmpty()) {
345                                tmp.add(base);
346                        } else {
347                                for (Modification<? extends SetupConfiguration> mod : facet
348                                        .getModifications()) {
349
350                                        if (mod.self()
351                                                .getName() == null) {
352                                                throw new RuntimeException(
353                                                                "Modifications must have a value for name"
354                                                );
355                                        }
356
357                                        SetupConfiguration modified = // ConfigMerger.INSTANCE
358//                                      .mergeConfiguration(
359                                                        ((ImmutableSetupConfiguration) ReflectionUtils
360                                                                .merge(base, mod)).withName(
361                                                                        facet.getDefault()
362                                                                                .getName() + ":"
363                                                                                        + mod.self()
364                                                                                                .getName()
365                                                                );
366
367                                        tmp.add(modified);
368                                }
369                        }
370
371                }
372
373                List<SetupConfiguration> tmp2 = new ArrayList<>();
374                for (var i = 0; i < this.getSetupReplications(); i++) {
375                        for (SetupConfiguration b : tmp) {
376                                tmp2.add(((ImmutableSetupConfiguration) b).withReplicate(i));
377                        }
378                }
379
380                return tmp2;
381
382        }
383
384        /**
385         * Gets the list of setup facets defining possible experiment configurations.
386         * Each facet contains a base configuration and optional modifications.
387         *
388         * @return List of setup configuration facets
389         * @see SetupFacet
390         */
391        List<SetupFacet> getSetupConfig();
392
393        /**
394         * Gets the number of replications to generate for each setup configuration.
395         *
396         * @return Number of setup replications (minimum 1)
397         */
398        int getSetupReplications();
399
400        /**
401         * Creates a new configuration with the specified execution configuration.
402         *
403         * @param config The new execution configuration to use
404         * @return New ExperimentConfiguration instance
405         */
406        default ImmutableExperimentConfiguration withExecutionConfig(
407                        ImmutableExecutionConfiguration config
408        ) {
409                return ImmutableExperimentConfiguration.builder()
410                        .from(this)
411                        .setExecutionConfig(config)
412                        .build();
413        }
414
415        /**
416         * Creates a new configuration with an additional execution facet containing
417         * the specified modifications. The facet will be named with the provided
418         * name parameter.
419         *
420         * @param name   Name for the new execution facet
421         * @param config Modifications to include in the new facet
422         * @return New ExperimentConfiguration instance
423         */
424        default ImmutableExperimentConfiguration withFacet(
425                        String name, PartialExecutionConfiguration... config
426        ) {
427                return ImmutableExperimentConfiguration.builder()
428                        .from(this)
429                        .addFacets(
430                                ImmutableExecutionFacet.builder()
431                                        .setName(name)
432                                        .setModifications(Arrays.asList(config))
433                                        .build()
434                        )
435                        .build();
436        }
437
438        /**
439         * Creates a new configuration with the specified setup configuration.
440         * Replaces any existing setup configurations with a single facet containing
441         * the provided configuration as its default.
442         *
443         * @param config The new setup configuration to use
444         * @return New ExperimentConfiguration instance
445         */
446        default ImmutableExperimentConfiguration withSetupConfig(
447                        SetupConfiguration config
448        ) {
449                return ImmutableExperimentConfiguration.builder()
450                        .from(this)
451                        .setSetupConfig(
452                                List.of(
453                                        ImmutableSetupFacet.builder()
454                                                .setDefault(config)
455                                                .build()
456                                )
457                        )
458                        .build();
459        }
460
461        /**
462         * Serializes this configuration to JSON and writes it to the specified path.
463         * If the path doesn't end with '.json', creates a 'config.json' file in the
464         * specified directory. Creates parent directories if needed.
465         *
466         * @param directoryOrFile Path to directory or file for output
467         * @param overwrite       If true, overwrites existing file; otherwise,
468         *                        throws an exception if the file already exists
469         * @throws StreamWriteException on JSON serialization errors
470         * @throws DatabindException    on data binding issues
471         * @throws IOException          on file system errors
472         * @see #readConfig(Path)
473         */
474        default void writeConfig(Path directoryOrFile, boolean overwrite)
475                        throws StreamWriteException, DatabindException, IOException {
476                var om = new ObjectMapper();
477                om.enable(SerializationFeature.INDENT_OUTPUT);
478                om.registerModules(new GuavaModule());
479                om.setSerializationInclusion(Include.NON_NULL);
480                if (!directoryOrFile.toString()
481                        .endsWith(".json")) {
482                        directoryOrFile = directoryOrFile.resolve("config.json");
483                }
484                Files.createDirectories(directoryOrFile.getParent());
485                if (overwrite) { Files.deleteIfExists(directoryOrFile); }
486                om.writeValue(directoryOrFile.toFile(), this);
487        }
488}
